choices.text:
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.

### Instruction:
For libreoffice calc write an expression to copy contents from another cell and remove all single quotes

### Response:

To copy contents from another cell and remove all single quotes in LibreOffice Calc, you can use the following formula: 

`=SUBSTITUTE(A1,"'","")`

In this example, A1 contains the original text with single quotes. The `SUBSTITUTE` function replaces all occurrences of the character "'" (which represents a single quote) with an empty string. This will remove all single quotes from the cell contents and leave only the text itself.
